etymologies: early 19th century: from Latin vermiculari ‘be full of worms’(because on expansion due to heat, it shoots out forms resembling small worms) + -ite

definitions: a yellow or brown mineral found as an alteration product of mica and other minerals, used for insulation or as a moisture-retentive medium for growing plants.
shortDefinitions: yellow or brown mineral found as alteration product of mica and other minerals
